clinical_study.brief_title: Influence of a High Fat Breakfast in the Pharmacokinetics of UH-AC62MU in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of a High Fat Breakfast in the Pharmacokinetics of UH-AC62MU (Rapid Release Tablet) Given as an Oral Single Dose of 7.5 mg in Healthy Subjects (Two Way, Crossover, Randomized, Open)

brief_summary.textblock: Influence of a high fat breakfast in the pharmacokinetic profile of the 7.5 mg meloxicam rapid releases tablet

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum measured concentration of the analyte in plasma (Cmax)
primary_outcome.time_frame: predose and up to 96 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte in plasma from time zero to infinity (AUC 0-infinity)
primary_outcome.time_frame: predose and up to 96 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: predose and up to 96 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte in plasma from time zero to t (AUC 0-t)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: predose and up to 96 hours after drug administration
predose and up to 96 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Terminal half-life of the analyte in plasma (t1/2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: predose and up to 96 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean residence time of the analyte total (MRT tot)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: predose and up to 96 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent clearance of the analyte in plasma following extravascular administration (CL/F)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: predose and up to 96 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent volume of distribution during the terminal phase λz following extravascular administration (Vz/F)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: predose and up to 96 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with abnormal changes in laboratory values
Number of Participants with Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to day 5 after last drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with abnormal changes from baseline in ECG
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, day 5 after last drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with abnormal changes from baseline in physical examination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, day 5 after last drug administration

arm_group.arm_group_label: meloxicam rapid release tablet after an overnight fast
meloxicam rapid release tablet after high fat breakfast

intervention.intervention_name: meloxicam rapid release tablet, 12mg, UH AC62MU
intervention.arm_group_label: meloxicam rapid release tablet after an overnight fast
meloxicam rapid release tablet after high fat breakfast

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy subjects as determined by results of screening
- Written informed consent according good clinical practice (GCP) and local legislation
- Age >=18 and <=50 years
- Broca >= -20% and <= +20%
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any finding of the medical examination (blood pressure, pulse rate and electrocardiogram (ECG)) deviating from the normal and of clinical relevance
- Gastrointestinal, hepatic, renal, respiratory, cardiovascular, metabolic, immunological or hormonal disorder
- Surgery of gastro-intestinal tract (except appendectomy)
- Disease of central nervous system (such as epilepsy) or psychiatric disorders or neurological disorder
- History of orthostatic hypotension, fainting spells or blackouts
- Chronic or relevant acute infections
- History of allergy/hypersensitivity (including drug allergy) which deemed relevant to the trial as judged by the investigator
- Intake of drugs with a long half-life ( >24h) (<=1month prior to administration)
- Use of any drugs which might influence the results of the trial (<=10 days prior to administration or during the trial)
- Participation in another trial with an investigational drug (<= 2 months prior to administration or during the trial)
- Smokers ( >10 cigarettes or >3 cigars or >3 pipes/day)
- Inability to refrain from smoking on trial days
- Alcohol abuse (>60g/day)
- Drug abuse
- Blood donation (<= 1 month prior to administration or during the trial)
- Excessive physical activities (<= 5 days prior to administration or during the trial)
- Any laboratory value outside the reference range of clinical relevance
- History of hemorrhagic diatheses
- History of gastro-intestinal ulcer, perforation or bleeding
- History of bronchial asthma
For female:
- Pregnancy
- Positive pregnancy test
- No adequate contraception e.g. sterilization, intrauterine device (IUD), oral contraceptives
- Inability to maintain this adequate contraception during the whole study period
- Lactation period
